item.title: Netbeans Jsf Mysql Primary Key
item.description: Cross-posted from The Java Jungle by Mark Heckler I recently had the opportunity to spin up a small web application using JSF and MySQL. Having developed JSF apps with Oracle Database back-ends before and possessing some small familiarity with MySQL (sans JSF), I thought this would be a cakewalk. Things did go pretty smoothly…but there was one little “gotcha” that took more time than the few seconds it really warranted.
